result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Santrecia M Sharp

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Santrecia M Sharp in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Santrecia M Sharp.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing.
For reasons set forth in the record, defense counsel requests additional time and status date. Court grants request.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 13.
Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Status conference scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Santrecia M Sharp in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Santrecia M Sharp.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD.
Due to court congestion, Court ordered case adjourned for Deferred Prosecution Agreement in Branch 13.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Santrecia M Sharp in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant to be TAD evaluated.   DPA Hearing schedule in Reserve Branch in Room 508 of the courthouse.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on August 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with T.S
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Santrecia M Sharp in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Defendant Santrecia M Sharp in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.
This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
